There's no such thing as neutral third parties. That's exactly the problem Bitcoin is supposed to solve.
@eric_lombrozo
 ¬∑ May 31, 2018
Proof of work only secures your transactions if miners are, as a whole, disinterested in your transactions (other than the miner fee). Having a neutral third party authorize a ledger is probably more secure than concentrated mining operations run by interested parties.
